description:
Dive into the health and performance of your F5 Networks appliances. Drill into health metrics from the Big IP and LTM platforms.  

* Read more about [Monitoring Datacenters and Network Devices with Datadog](https://www.datadoghq.com/blog/datacenter-monitoring-dashboards/)
* For more configuration details, check out the Network Device Monitoring [documentation](https://docs.datadoghq.com/network_monitoring/devices/)  

datadog_demo_keep:true
title: F5 Networks

definition.content:
How to use this dashboard: 

Use template variables above to filter to a device by name, or IP with `$snmp_host` and `$snmp_device`, respectively. 

Filter to specific node, virtual servers and pools by name using `$node`, `$server`, and `$pool`. 

**Note:** Some widgets may be pre-filtered to top 25 due to the high number of timeseries a query can generate. Use template variables to filter to specific device.

The following widgets are filtered to the highest usage/utilization per interface. 

Click a line in any graph and select the `Interface Performance` under _Custom Links_ to navigate to a dashboard specifically for performance metrics about an interface including state & status.

definition.title: Interfaces with the Most Discarded Packets

definition.content: Traffic Management Module (TMM) processes all load balanced traffic on the Big-IP System.

definition.title: Total memory used from non-TMM modules

definition.content: Widgets below are by default filtered to the top 25 pools. Use the template variable `$pool` to filter to a specific pool, or `$snmp_device` and `$snmp_host` to filter to specific device by IP or sysName.

Widgets below are by default filtered to the top 25 pool members. Use the template variable `$pool` and `$node` to filter to a specific pool/node group (member), or `$snmp_device` and `$snmp_host` to filter to specific device by IP or sysName.

Widgets below are by default filtered to the top 25 virtual servers. Use the template variable `$virtual-server` to filter to a specific server, or `$snmp_device` and `$snmp_host` to filter to specific device by IP or sysName.

definition.title: Current Client Connections on Virtual Server
Total Client Connections on Virtual Server

definition.content: Widgets below are by default filtered to the top 25 nodes. Use the template variable `$node` to filter to a specific node, or `$snmp_device` and `$snmp_host` to filter to specific device by IP or sysName.

definition.title: # Connections either in FIN-WAIT/CLOSING or CLOSE-WAIT/LAST-ACK
